Message.Title: Combatting the Dangerous Rise of Bath Salts
Message.Msg: Dear Fellow New Yorker, The illegal use of bath salts and other synthetic drugs has become increasingly widespread and poses a serious threat to public health and safety in New York State. This year, there have already been 191 emergency room visits in upstate New York as a result of using bath salts. These visits show a drastic increase from the 39 reported visits in 2011. *** Naturally, Governor Andrew Cuomo thinks we need new regulations to "combat" this. How about this: Allow the idiots to die and send their families a posthumous Darwin Award. Thank you for being thoughtful enough to exit the human gene pool!

Message.Msg: I can only marvel at your patience. As far as I can tell, the entity now posting under the handle "krarners-ghost" is a (virtual) machine that is broken, and it is not capable of fixing itself. The likelihood that it will remedy its defects in response to anything you or I say being pretty nearly nil, the only way it will get fixed is for its designer (i.e. programmer) to bear a hand. And the likelihood of that is also pretty near nil, because it is succeeding at its intended purpose, as I see it, namely to hurt us in real-life terms, specifically by WASTING OUR TIME. It can't hope to convince anyone with more than half a brain of anything, so we have to consider that convincing anyone of anything is not its purpose. What it does succeed at, and consistently, must be its purpose; otherwise it would not continue to exist and consume resources.
